Abstract: Black Americans honor anniversary of Emancipation Proclamation, as they have done every year since it took effect Jan 1, 1863, declaring slaves in South free and heightening momentum for abolition of slavery two years later through 13th Amendment; five-page yellowed document is kept in air-conditioned vault in National Archives in Washington; photos (M)
Snippet: Black Americans honor anniversary of Emancipation Proclamation, as they have done every year since it took effect Jan 1, 1863, declaring slaves in South free and heightening momentum for abolition of slavery two years later through 13th Amendment;...
LeadParagraph: As people wake up this morning with the future on their minds, having left the 1900's for the 2000's, William Stallings will prepare to look back, 137 years to be exact.

Headline.Main: Celebrating a Milestone for Freedom; Black Americans Honor Anniversary of Proclamation to End Slavery
Headline.PrintHeadline: Celebrating a Milestone for Freedom; Black Americans Honor Anniversary of Proclamation to End Slavery
